Review_body: As a finished product, this film seemingly has it all- an intense rooftop chase, a hero at odds with his superiors, romance, a deranged assassin, a dramatic showdown between the good guy and the bad guy etc. But there is an air of the routine about this one, a certain predictability pervades throughout. This Eastwood action thriller will entertain you, guaranteed. But I wish it has some plot twists or a more jarring ending or such . Overall a very good film with taut directing, but it aint Dirty Harry.
I love this movie. Cool, reasonable, slow, fast and tense. John Malkovich as a complete psycho, but very competent. Clint takes care of the psycho in the end. Very cool.

Frank (Clint) is a former Secret Service agent who failed to prevent the assassination of Kennedy, many years later he is there again trying to protect the president, but this time the guy who is trying to kill the president begins to get involved in a game with FrankVery enjoyable.

This movie is worth seeing just to revel in John Malkovich's virtuoso performance.  For an entertaining theme evening -- the theme being film psychotics who wish, for money or passion, to do violent damage to the American president -- show this flick as a double feature with The Jackal starring Bruce Willis.  Both of these movies have really creepy bad guys, extremely well portrayed (although Malkovich is the greater artist); both are well shot and have cute men and women that are fun to look at; both have lots of plot twists which, predictable or not, are fun to ride along with. Jolly good cheese, well served, nice and cold.

Seriously any film with John Malkovich is usually very good. And this includes Clint Eastwood, Rene Russo, John Mahoney (Frasier), Dylan McDermott (The Practice), and many more great actors.Clint is getting old now but thanks he is also an awesome director (in his own right).We are used to Wolfgang "water films" like Das Boot, Poseidon and Perfect Storm - this was really different but just as sublimely directed.The premise of the assassin is as serious as it comes, the film is well paced, some of the violence is a bit... But altogether recommended (but not for kids).

A good film. Clint his usual Dirty Harry type personality. John malkovich is very good you can see why good choice for con air.
Rene Russo very underrated actress.

Enjoyable watch! - A really well written movie about secret service agents, assassins and the president. The characters were not complicated and both protagonist and antagonist had well mapped out backstories. A very good supporting cast also. A vastly entertaining film that never gets boring or is slow. It could have done with a few more action sequences, but nevertheless; very interesting & very thrilling!

Wolfgang Petersen's In the Line of Fire is definitely one of his best. It's clever filmmaking with a great script, great actors, and a lot of tension. John Malkovitch is unforgettable as the would-be assassin. The film is also very authentic where it deals with the Kennedy assassination, and Clint Eastwood is very believable as a Secret Service agent. The climax of this film is so exciting that it will have your adrenalin pumping and your pulse racing. This is probably the best political thriller of the decade.

In the line of fire is an absolutely top notch thriller that still holds up nearly thirty years after it's release. It's got a fairly outlandish yet still somehow believable plot that is tautly directed, superbly acted, and is for my money one of Clint Eastwood's top 5 films, which is no mean feat considering his body of work.All the main cast here are excellent, rene Russo is a great foil for Clint's grizzled, yet still cheeky character, which I think is one of his last really great acting roles, he's in such commanding form here, he's emotional, aggressive and really funny at times and has some great one liners too. Along with 'unforgiven' it's hands down his best performance of the 90s and maybe even the 80s too. John malkovich is truly outstanding - He's creepy, unhinged, ruthless, methodical and brilliant. He is an absolutely fantastic antagonist and is a pure force of nature - easily one of the best villains in any film, regardless of genre, he's that good. I think it's one of the best performances of his career, if not his best. His and Clint's performance are the heart of this film and it's absolutely glorious to watch it unfold, they elevate this film from the merely good to the great. This picture is full of tension, action, violence, romance, humour and heartbreak, you name it, it's superbly entertaining and inventive from start to finish.There's even some really solid character work with the more fringe characters which adds plenty to the story without bogging it down.The action scenes are tense, never OTT and service the story perfectly with some good twists on the way. I like that it's set within real time events with the Kennedy assassination too. The score is also very good indeed.Honestly? I not only think this one of the best thrillers of the 90s but of all time. I'm struggling to fault it in any way. It's a a ten out of ten for me.
Boring boring boring. This film goes nowhere very slowly. Just tedious. I got three quarters through and gave up.

This film,in my opinion, is up there with dirty harry, Gran Torino and million dollar baby, Eastwood best films hes acted/directed in. I have absolutely no problems with this film whatsoever it is suspenseful, romantic, powerful and never has a dull moment. Obviously its not as good as the likes of Shawshank, the godfather and se7en but still similar to films likes of phone booth, rocky 2 and die hard 4.0 have been hard done by by the the critics.I would highly recommend this film to anyone who really listens to the dialogue and enjoys suspenseful thrillers. Again Eastwood never fails to please me.

This is a standard action flick as we have seen them many times before. Not much action in this one though. Again it's about the guy protecting the president. He's macho - as usual, and at the same time soft and melancholic - as usual. Does he have the guts to take a bullet for the president?! And then there's the girl and the usual conservative flirting around. Stereotypical and predictable to the last toe-crumbling minute.

Review title: Thrillers don't get much better than this, don't miss it
Review_body: "In the Line of Fire" is one of the best thrillers I have seen, it builds and builds to a great climax. This film really draws you in your heart is beating and you are out of breath from the action. The cast turns in strong peformances, particularly Clint Eastwood and John Malkovich. This film is expertly directed by suspense master Wolfgang Petersen. Thrillers don't get much better thn this, don't miss it.

Clint Eastwood is just outstanding as usual, John Malkovich with a more difficult role stole the show but the movie is made for you to be on the agent's side. I really enjoyed it even though at some point I thought everything was taking a bit too long.

Review title: Less action than you might think
Review_body: Altho it does have the old movie adage...characters?and dude, you're old enough to be her father.
Good Clint Eastwood movie. I enjoy it worth watching.My Grade: B.

One of the finest movies I have viewed...Good script, original plot of a man who is haunted about JFK's assassination when he was assigned to protect him on that Cold November day in 1963. Thirty years later another anti-social lunatic wants to assassinate the current president. The secret service agent loses his partner along the way,to the crazed gunmen who schemes,lies and murders anybody in his path who'll stand in his way of his mission. The movie  accompanies with a great memorable score,and a restrained but meaningful romance between Russo and Eastwood....which displays how difficult it is to have a romantic life in that kind of work. Malchovich is great,sure many other candidates could have played the role that he played,but how many could acted with such craftiness,and intellect that he displayed in the movie?Needless to say,I thought this was a great movie...everytime it's on television I have to watch it..and I own it on dvd! I'm a big Eastwood fan,this only boosted his already fabulous career,and Malchovich's best role to date!
This is one of my favorite films - I've watched and re-watched it dozens of times. Clint Eastwood, John Malkovich, Rene Russo, John Mahoney, and plenty of others are wonderful!

In the Line of Fire is an entertaining action thriller that will keep the viewers hooked throughout the length of the movie. Nostalgic viewers who long for the action movies of the yore will love watching or rewatching this. This type of action thriller has a specific brand that is associated with the late 20th century era.This was my first Clint Eastwood movie and I can see his charm and appeal that made him a household name. Eastwood has an overwhelmingly positive presence that carries the movie smoothly. His voice is heavy, gentle and melodic. His effortless portrayal of Frank Hooligan - a long time Secret Service agent with a dark past - bears the marks of a veteran.John Malkovich as Mitch Leary puts up a brilliant performance as the antagonist to match up with Clint Eastwood. His cold voice and manic demeanor provides a good contrast with Eastwood's commanding tone and controlled manner. Rene Russo as Lilly Raines amd the other supporting actors did her bit as well.Modern viewers might find some of the scenes and even the whole dynamic between Clint Eastwood and Rene Russo problematic. This doesn't take away from the quality of the movie but will stick out for some viewers.Wolfgand Peterson did a brilliant job in maintaining the pace of the movie. Nowhere does the movie feel dragged out or going too fast. Peterson keeps the viewers hooked not by excessive action scenes but by simply using the prowess of the two leading actors. The scenes between the two are well written and directed.For viewers who want to reminisce about the action thrillers of the past, this movie might be a good place to start.

Review title: Thrilling drama that has a brain
Review_body: I am a huge fan of big, loud, trashy, completely stupid action movies such as The Rock, Con Air etc.  All of these are great fun to watch but, when you think about it, extremely silly.  IN THE LINE OF FIRE tells a story and it tells it well.  With plausibility as well as excitement and suspense it also addressed several important moral questions that really make you think. The last shot of the movie is Eastwood and Russo sitting together on the steps of the White house watching the pigeons to gentle, peaceful music and I felt a deep feeling of satisfaction.  This was because I cared about the characters and I was happy for them that their story had come to a happy conclusion.  It felt like a true story.  As the aging secret service agent tormented by the fact that he failed to protect JFK on that fateful day in Dallas, Clint Eastwood is fantastic.  He brilliantly conveys his paranoia and his personal need to stop his adversary.  On the other side of the spectrum is John Malkovich, as the creepy predator who tortures Eastwood about what happened in 1963 by openly telling him of his plan to kill the current president.  This Oscar nominated performance really gets under your skin.  Throughout the movie, Malkovich talks to Eastwood as if they are friends.  He doesn't threaten him, he doesn't lie to him, he doesn't laugh at him, but he tortures him with his unbearable friendliness right up to the last moment.  As well as this thrilling main plot, there is a charming love story involving Rene Russo, another agent and Eastwood.  Despite the age difference, they have superb chemistry on screen and the director wisely does not let this dominate too much but keeps it as part of the backdrop which works nicely. To sum up, I love this film because it has a mind.

Review title: Even Clint Eastwood Makes A Bomb Now And Then
Review_body: There is so much wrong with this movie, I hardly know where to begin! We are supposed to believe that an agent too old for his job, and easily winded, would be employed by the secret service in the first place. After that.....the "super cop" stereotypes come fast and furious. Of course Eastwoods character once guarded JFK....and of course, we are told how he was JFK's "favorite agent", and we are told how he...of course, took the blame when JFK was found with a girl in the white house. Everyone is here....the psycho ex CIA assassin over acted by John Malkovitch......the "asshole" Chief Of Staff who seems to be more concerned with poll numbers than a threat to the presidents life, the lead agent who we are supposed to believe thinks that Eastwoods character is "over reacting" to a threat to the presidents life...AFTER he and every other agent have already listened to the psycho's threat on a tapped phone call. And finally......as if we hadn't already figured out the ending 5 minutes into the movie, Eastwoods character ends up saving the Presidents life! By that time, you won't care anyway, because you will be too busy shouting "bullshit" at the screen as one unrealistic scene after the other flashes by. Take a Pass...you'll thank me for it.

Review title: Grabbing your attention from start to finish
Review_body: A very enjoyable thriller with Eastwood in the role of a secret service agent in a battle of wits with John Malkovich who has threatened to assassinate the President. Great cast and good direction by Wolfgang Peterson. Clint Eatwood is at his normal best but in the end Malkovich steals the show with a masterful villainous portrayal of Mitch Leary.

This movie kept my interest but in the end there was no heart in it.  Going through the motions. Immorality of trained government assassins versus morality of "just doing my job" to protect life. Impressively evil character.

Review title: So close to making a perfect movie
Review_body: What a brilliant film. Seriously, I commend everyone involved in the production of this movie. Great performances and overall hard work all around. This movie has everything going for it. An awesome screenplay, a captivating, stunning performance from John Malkovich, and a creepy yet thrilling aura surrounding every scene. This movie could have easily catapulted into one of my favorites ever. It is a very entertaining movie.Of course, it does have its flaws. The biggest flaw to this movie is Rene Russo's character. Now I recognize the need for strong female characters. But she's not exactly a strong character at all. In fact, her character is never really significant throughout the entire film. I respect Russo as an actress, and I'm sure if the screenplay was further refined, her character could have been developed further. Still, I recommend it. It makes for a fun movie night, and it's ever enjoyable despite some flaws, which you can easily get over by paying attention to how awesome Eastwood and Malkovich's battle of wits really is.

Review title: I sat bolt upright in the cinema, had there been a more suspenseful film?
Review_body: The person responsible for writing the storyline to this great movie must be a outstanding teller of tales. In my job as a teacher I tell stories to the kids direct from my imagination. I try to get the kids pondering what the next twist will be. This film does exactly that. John Malkovich plays one of the best "bad guy" roles in the last 30 years, a real credit as lots of his other roles are not of this genre. His portrayal as Lennie in "Of Mice & Men" seems light years away from the psychopath he brings to the screen here. The role played by Clint Eastwood is straight out of his "Dirty Harry" days but the romantic aspect, played very convincingly by Russo, bring s a new dimension to Clint and saves the film to some degree. There are plenty of films depicting cops dealing with nutters, some involve protecting heads of state but none come close to the drama which unfolds in front of the viewer. This is another gem which failed to make the box office ring over big time, here in Oz anyway,and will be shown on late night free to air telly. When talk is made of Clint's movies this title will be overlooked in favour of "Harry" and a few westerns (all good films by the way). When the same talk is made of Malkovich films however, along with "Mice" this one should be a standout. A thriller from go to whoa.
For some reason, they're not even capable of making films like this anymore.

One of the most intelligent and mature action/thriller films you will find. Eastwood and Malkovich are perfect for their parts. Writing and directing are superb as is the score by Ennio Morricone. Truly a film to be emulated.

Review title: On my all time top five list of action movies
Review_body: I have seen quite a few action thrillers in my life and this is clearly one of the best ever! There are very few films which I even consider watching several times and this is one of them. Everything in this movie is just right: Clint as the superb leading actor, Rene Russo as his non-stupid female partner(this is a very rare combination - sad,but true!). Of course, John Malkowich deserves a lot of praise for his excellent villain but let us not overlook Eastwood`s initial buddy, played by Dylan Mcdermott, who in my view fits the role perfectly.The soundtrack is absolutely fantastic - but sadly never released on an original soundtrack CD (shame on the producers!). The plot makes sense and there is no loss of pace, the audience is kept in constant excitement of the outcome of the duel between Eastwood and Malkowich. I give this one 10 Stars!

In the line of Fire is a perfect testimonial to John Malkovich's wonderful acting. He is truly one of the best. His ablity to transform himself in so many different ways, from Biff Lowman in "Death of a Salesman" to Mitch Leary in this film, is excellent. Clint Eastwood also delivers a steller performance along with his partner Dylan McCdermott, who is now doing some acting in "The Practice". A great cast, a great story line, a great film.

"In The Line of Fire" is a great action packed thriller film with superb acting and direction from Wolfgang Petersen (Air Force One).Secret Service Agent Frank Horrigan was a bodyguard for many years, and he was present at the assassination of President John F. Kennedy, but did not respond to the shots, and as he was the closer bodyguard, this still haunts him. One day he receives a call from a crazed stalker and trained army assassin, calling himself Booth, and threatens to kill the president. Now Frank along with the department, including Secret Service Agent Lilly Raines (Rene Russo), are trying to find this assassin, real name Mitch Leary (a sensational performance from John Malkovich).Frank also gets onto the team that protects the current President (Jim Curley). There are some great chase sequences, near catches and complications to ending the whole thing, including a great scene where Frank could kill Mitch, but fall to his death, and his partner Secret Service Agent Al D'Andrea (Miracle on 34th Street's Dylan McDermott) is killed as a result. The final scenes at a conference with the President is most gripping, seeing if Frank can make it and save the leader, and seeing if disguised Mitch can succeed in killing him with his own made gun. Also starring Gary Cole as Secret Service Presidential Detail Agent-In-Charge Bill Watts, John Mahoney as Secret Service Director Sam Campagna, Gregory Alan Williams as Secret Service Agent Matt Wilder and Saw's Tobin Bell as Mendoza.Doesn't get any better, I give it a solid 10!

For those of you who enjoy extraordinary suspense, incredibly believable characters and antiheroes. John Malkovich is as scary as ever in the role of Booth. I can't stop hearing his voice talking to Horrigan, a perfect performance by Clint Eastwood. There is not much to be said without spoiling, so I'm only telling that you should watch this movie.
A movie that doesn't get much attention but is one of Clint Eastwood's best non-Western movies with an amazing performance from John Malkovich.

In the Line of Fire is an great thriller.Its realistic and yet exciting.The script is well writen,leaving room for drama and character development.The best thing in the film is the performance of Clint Eastwood(who,in my opinion, makes the best role in his career).He really brings the character of Frank Horrigan to live.The other cast members deserve the honours as well,particually John Malkovich.In overall Wolfgan Petersen has directed an fantastic thriller that should be considered as an classic. I give it 9 out of 10!!!

its amazing how all these new movies are getting 8.3's and a classic like this is rated lower.John Malkovich as was absolutely amazing in this movie and Clint was Clint. Rene Russo was amazing, as she always is. John Malkovich has to definitely go down as one of the top 10 bad guys after this movie. Seriously, when was the last time someone possessed his acting skill. I still don't understand why he is not in more movies. Clint Eastwood showed in this movie again why he will be our generation's John Wayne. You always root for Clint. He plays the macho bad ass role better than most. And for him to do this movie at the age he was at shows his range.

......because it IS Dirty Harry. OK plot/acting/ photography/music score.....and a remake of Dirty Harry. Tell me how it is different. Cop who is at odds with his superiors is pitted against a psychopathic killer that somehow is too clever to be caught, and is especially sinister. Sort of but doesn't get along with a partner. Sort of but doesn't really hook up with sultry female costar. Vindicates himself in the end with the villain finally getting his just desserts. The whole movie peppered with cheesy lines stolen from an Arnold Schwarzenegger movie that were originally stolen from a Clint Eastwood movie. It is possible to sit through this movie but you are not seeing anything original.

Quite simply a well-made, well-written and wonderfully acted movie. Eastwood is classic as grizzled Secret Service Agent Frank Horrigan and Rene Russo holds her own as partner (and love interest) Lilly Raines. But the movie's greatness rests on the shoulders of John Malkovich as "Booth". He captures this character's rage and hatred, as well as his humanity oddly enough.Personally I think this was his best performance and should have received an Oscar for it (But I loved Tommy Lee Jones in The Fugitive as well that year). Overall a great movie to see you want to peek into an assassin's mind and be on the edge of your seat the whole way through. Enjoy!!
